alert.note: Alert for Gila; Maricopa (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 17 at 2:33PM MST until August 17 at 6:30PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Gila County in east central Arizona... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... * Until 630 PM MST. * At 233 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Campaign Creek. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Roosevelt, Tonto National Monument and Roosevelt Estates. This includes AZ Route 188 between mile markers 229 and 238. This includes the following streams and drainages... Salt River, Campaign Creek, Tonto Creek, Pine Creek, Burnt Corral Creek and Reavis Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
